result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrel D. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrel D. Patterson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrel D. Patterson was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and pay DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with standard rules of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate in AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Associated with Charge #1
Corrected to show revocation period.

Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andrel D. Patterson IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant's driver operating privileges REVOKED for a period of 6 months.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andrel D. Patterson IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed outright.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Andrel D. Patterson not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is currently in custody in Sturtevant, WI.
Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 11-06-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for Catelin Ringersma for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 09-10-2014 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Andrel D. Patterson in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  ADA Jennifer Williams approved quick date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
